statute_citation: General Provisions Article, Section 4-101 et seq., Annotated Code of Maryland
notes: 30-day response deadline with 10-day extension notice requirement. Public Access Ombudsman mediates disputes. PIA Compliance Board for formal complaints.

basic_request.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request
basic_request.body:
Dear PIA Representative:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, General Provisions Article ยง4-101 et seq., I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

Please respond to this request within 30 days as required by law. If you anticipate the response will take more than 10 working days, please notify me within 10 working days with an estimated timeline and fee range as required by ยง4-203.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide written reasons for the denial and notice of review remedies within 10 working days.

I prefer to receive responsive records electronically when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if clarification is needed.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

ombudsman_complaint.subject: Public Access Ombudsman Assistance - PIA Request Dispute
ombudsman_complaint.body:
Dear Public Access Ombudsman:

I am requesting your assistance with a Maryland Public Information Act dispute. On [DATE], I submitted a PIA request to [AGENCY] for [DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS].

The agency [denied my request/failed to respond/charged unreasonable fees] on [DATE]. I believe this response violates the PIA because [REASON].

I would appreciate your assistance in mediating this dispute before considering a formal complaint to the PIA Compliance Board.

Attached are copies of my original request and the agency's response.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[CONTACT INFORMATION]
